Subject: New User Questions
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=232543811; y=DSREgvgKumgVV4OK4uUCCM3awbCB-8MDtsYDC5w7oCyMwSfOZt7ileDnaYg

Hi,

I have a couple of questions that I'd like to put to the group.  I 
suppose these questions may have been asked before but I've spend 
sometime searching through past messages with not much success.

1. Why is it that if I create a network with 10 input nodes and 1 
output nodes, when I use the newwork viewer application is show the 
network as haveing 11 input nodes?

2. I've created an experiment where most test require a simple 
network in order to get the right answer.  However, a few of the 
tests require a more complex solution.  What seems to be happening 
is that the searching process quickly finds the simple network but 
which achieves about 94% of the fitness but never finds a network 
that fits the complete solution.  I think a solution should be 
possible as the inputs are logically created.  I think the more 
specialised species are being wiped-out before they get the change 
to evolve properly.  What changes to my network parameters can I 
make to increase the change of more complex networks?

Regards
Chris Turner
